text.text_translated: After the age of ten, most people have four to six dreams every night, which amounts to about 2,000 dreams annually. So, by the time an average person reaches the age of 80, they might have had 140,000 dreams. Even though we forget 95 to 99 per cent of our dreams, we still recall a few thousand of them in a lifetime. For this reason, it is understandable that a dream can be followed by a similar real-life event, just by coincidence, especially if the dream is about something that occurs frequently in everyday life.
